column2: ශ්‍රී ලංකාව සඳහා සාමාන්‍යය කාලගුණ අන්‍ාවැකිය
GENERAL WEATHER FORECAST FOR SRI LANKA
ජාතික කාලගුණ විදයා මධ්‍යස්ථානහේ, අනාවැකි අංශය මගින් නිකුත් කරන ලදි
Issued by Forecasting Division, National Meteorological Centre
WEATHER FORECAST FOR SEA AREAS AROUND THE ISLAND DURING NEXT 24 HOURS
A low-pressure area is formed over south Andaman Sea and adjoining southeast Bay of
Bengal Sea area. It is likely to move west-northwestwards and intensify into a depression
over southeast Bay of Bengal around 29th November 2023.
Fishing and naval community are requested to be attentive to future forecasts issued by
the Department of Meteorology in this regard.
Condition of Rain:
Showers  or  thundershowers  will  occur  at  several  places  in  the  sea  areas  off  the  coast
extending from Trincomalee to Puttalam via Pottuvil, Hambantota and Galle.
Winds will be North-easterly. Wind speed will be (30-40) kmph in the sea areas off the coast
extending  from  Chilaw  to  Trincomalee  via  Puttalam,  Kankasanthurai.  And  from  Galle  to
Hambantota via Matara. Wind speed will be (20-30) kmph in the other sea areas around
sea  areas  off
Kankasanthurai and from Galle to Hambantota via Matara will be moderate and  slight in
the other sea areas around the island.
strong
thundershowers.
Rainfall amount (mm): Light: 00-12.5, Light to moderate: 12.5-25, Moderate: 25-50, Fairly heavy rain: 50 -100,

column4: Heavy rain: 100 – 150, Very heavy rain: 150 or more.
